name: Mild Beef, Broccoli & Pepper Stir-Fry with Brown Basmati Rice
description: Tender soy-glazed beef tossed with roasted broccoli and bell peppers, finished with spring onion, served over brown basmati rice. A mild, high-protein family dinner.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups brown basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cut 700–800 g beef sirloin steak into thin strips across the grain.
Cut 2 heads of broccoli into bite-size florets; slice stems thinly.
Slice 4 spring onion (white and green parts separated).
In a bowl, whisk 6 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp honey, 1.5 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 cup water, and 2 tbsp cornflour until smooth.
cook_steps: Start rice: Add rinsed brown basmati rice to a pot with 4 cups water and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce to low, cover, and simmer 25–30 minutes until tender. Rest 5 minutes, then fluff.
Roast vegetables: On a large baking sheet, toss broccoli and bell peppers with 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and black pepper. Roast 12–15 minutes until crisp-tender and lightly charred.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear beef: Pat beef dry, season lightly with salt and black pepper, then cook in two batches 2–3 minutes per side until just browned. Transfer to a plate.
Lower heat to medium. Add a small splash of olive oil if needed. Add minced garlic and the white parts of spring onion; cook 30–45 seconds until fragrant.
Whisk the sauce again and pour into the skillet. Stir constantly 1–2 minutes until glossy and slightly thickened.
Return beef and any juices to the pan. Toss 30–60 seconds to coat.
Add roasted broccoli and bell peppers. Toss 1–2 minutes to combine and warm through. Adjust seasoning with a little more soy sauce or water to taste.
Serve beef and vegetables over fluffed brown basmati rice. Garnish with the green parts of spring onion.

Cut 700–800 g beef sirloin steak into thin strips across the grain.
Cut 2 heads of broccoli into bite-size florets; slice stems thinly.
Slice 4 spring onion (white and green parts separated).
In a bowl, whisk 6 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp honey, 1.5 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 cup water, and 2 tbsp cornflour until smooth.

Start rice: Add rinsed brown basmati rice to a pot with 4 cups water and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce to low, cover, and simmer 25–30 minutes until tender. Rest 5 minutes, then fluff.
Roast vegetables: On a large baking sheet, toss broccoli and bell peppers with 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and black pepper. Roast 12–15 minutes until crisp-tender and lightly charred.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear beef: Pat beef dry, season lightly with salt and black pepper, then cook in two batches 2–3 minutes per side until just browned. Transfer to a plate.
Lower heat to medium. Add a small splash of olive oil if needed. Add minced garlic and the white parts of spring onion; cook 30–45 seconds until fragrant.
Whisk the sauce again and pour into the skillet. Stir constantly 1–2 minutes until glossy and slightly thickened.
Return beef and any juices to the pan. Toss 30–60 seconds to coat.
Add roasted broccoli and bell peppers. Toss 1–2 minutes to combine and warm through. Adjust seasoning with a little more soy sauce or water to taste.
Serve beef and vegetables over fluffed brown basmati rice. Garnish with the green parts of spring onion.

ingredients.quantity: 1 cup for sauce + 4 cups for rice

final_ingredients.quantity: 1 cup for sauce + 4 cups for rice
